intro: Silene densiflora subsp. sillingeri, commonly known as the Sierra violet, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture, adapted to its cool, humid habitat. Silene densiflora subsp. sillingeri is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy, often pink or purple flowers.
